creator: deruysscher@grip.nl
text:
Server version: Apache/1.3.33 (Unix)
Server built:   Apr  6 2005 13:05:25

FreeBSD xx.xx.grip.nl 5.3-RELEASE-p5 FreeBSD 5.3-RELEASE-p5 #3: Fri Feb 25
19:11:07 CET 2005     /usr/obj/usr/src/sys/GENERIC  i386

One of our Apache webserver has stopped logging for a vhost for 17 days.
Yesterdaythe logs started to work again without any changes / user intervention.

Apache is gracefully restarted every day after rotating logs by an external script. 

Bug is not reproduceable, but occurs every now and then.

Apache HTTP Server 1.3.x is not supported anymore and no bugs will be fixed in the old codebase (cf. <http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201002.mbox/%3C20100203000334.GA19021@infiltrator.stdlib.net%3E>). Since this bug seems to affect only 1.3.x, I'm closing it as WONTFIX.

If this bug still affects you in a recent version (version 2.2.x or the upcoming version 2.4), please open a new bug.

Thank you for reporting the bug.
creator: mss@apache.org
